result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd A. Bailey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not own m/v w/o agents approval.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia.  Absolute Sobriety. State has 30 days to request restitution.   ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Todd A. Bailey in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Defendant Todd A. Bailey in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Both parties recv'd and reviewed PSI report.  State gives recommendation 5 yrs (2yrs IC/3 yrs. ES) $518, DNA, Absolute sobriety; AODA/treatment; No entry into bars, taverns, liquor stores where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol. 226 days credit not including today's date.  Atty. Dolch makes recommendation of 3 years probation or 1 yr IC/2 yrs ES.  Atty. Dolch also reads a letter the DE wrote to the victim.  Court admonished DE. 

Court imposes sentence.

WI State Prison for 5years (2 years IC/3 years ES)  
226 days credit
Submit to DNA Sample/Surcharge
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
Absolute Sobriety
No entry into bars, taverns, liquor stores where primary purpose is sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia
Obtain/maintain full time employment
Not own m/v w/o agents approval
30 days to make request for restitution
$518.00 Costs & Supervision Fees
Not -  Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Paperwork handed in court.
Sentencing hearing on July 18, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Todd A. Bailey in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Todd A. Bailey in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Middleton states matter is resolved and states recs.  PSI to be requested w/sentencing being set out.  State is in agreement.  Court clarifies that the NGI issue has been resolved.  Atty Middleton withdraws NGI plea.  DE agrees.  Court accepts withdrawal of NGI plea.  Atty Middleton enters NC plea to Ct 1.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty and orders PSI be completed no later than 7/8/2016.  Sentencing date to be set.  Bond continues pending sentencing.

Defendant Todd A. Bailey appeared by video means with Attorney Middleton. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Attorney Middleton advises defendant is eligible and gives new address.  State gives criminal history out of several states.  State request $1500.00 cash bond and absolute sobriety and may not oper MV w/out valid DL.  Attorney Middleton request signature bond.  Time limits waived. $1000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  absolute sobriety and may not oper MV w/out valid DL.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
